title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 13 December 2012 - XWiki
content:
<xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
00:49 <fmancinelli> has quit

11:32 <vmassol> going to start preparing for the 4.4M1release

11:42 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:55 <vmassol> version in jira created up to 5.0M1 and dates set  
11:55 <vmassol> s/version/versions  
11:55 <vmassol> mflorea: could you move the issues you're assigned to ?  
11:56 <vmassol> mflorea: wdyt of moving http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7374 to 5.0M1?  
11:56 <vmassol> I don't think we'll have the time in 4.5, ?yt?  
11:56 <vmassol> wdyt?  
11:56 <mflorea> vmasol: yes, 5.0M1  
12:05 <vmassol> Enygma`: you have stuff to fix for 4.4M1 release?  
12:07 <vmassol> mflorea: only issues assigned to you remain now for 4.4M1, can you please move them into 4.4RC1 or 4.5M1 ?  
12:07 <vmassol> and keep the ones for 4.4M1 if there's any :)  
12:10 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
12:13 <mflorea> vmassol: ok  
12:26 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
12:27 <vmassol> ok release notes done for 4.4M1, please check it's ok: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki44M1  
12:31 <ldubost> Another question. I'll have some html/js code that I will package as a zip (this I know you can do with maven and I plan to call that module js). Now my objective would be to make that zip and attachment to an XWiki page from the wiki module  
12:31 <ldubost> Is there a way to do that ?  
12:32 <ldubost> if yes, what do I need to put in my pom, if not what could be an alternate strategy knowing that I need to make this zip available for the Wiki Macro to use it  
12:34 <vmassol> ldubost: I think you need to use our xmldoc-update-plugin  
12:34 <ldubost> vmassol: any usage example ?  
12:35 <vmassol> you can check xwiki-platform-workspaces-ui module  
12:35 <vmassol> it's using it  
12:35 <vmassol> or wiki-manager-ui in the manager git repo  
12:36 <vmassol> jvelo coded this plugin AFAIR  
12:36 <vmassol> it has an "attach" goal  
12:37 <vmassol> now I'm not saying if that's the best way for your use case but I kjow it'll allow you to add some attachment to a page during the build  
12:38 <ldubost> sounds right this module  
12:38 <ldubost> will try  
12:40 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:43 <ldubost> And what is the simplest way to package the content of src/main/ressources inside a zip file as the target of a maven build ?  
12:45 <vmassol> assembly plugin  
12:45 <vmassol> you'll need 2 modules  
12:52 <ldubost> I've done this  
12:52 <ldubost> <project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/maven-v4\_0\_0.xsd">  
12:52 <ldubost>    <groupId>org.xwiki.contrib</groupId>  
12:52 <ldubost>    <artifactId>xwiki-macro-pdf-parent</artifactId>  
12:52 <ldubost>   </parent>  
12:52 <ldubost>   <artifactId>xwiki-macro-pdf-js</artifactId>  
12:52 <ldubost>   <name>XWiki Macro - PDF Viewer - Javascript</name>  
12:52 <ldubost>   <version>1.0-SNAPSHOT</version>  
12:52 <ldubost>   <build>  
12:53 <ldubost>       <plugin>  
12:53 <ldubost>         <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>  
12:53 <ldubost>           <descriptors>  
12:53 <ldubost>           </descriptors>  
12:53 <ldubost>         </configuration>  
12:53 <ldubost>     </plugins>  
12:53 <ldubost> </project>  
12:53 <ldubost> <assembly>  
12:53 <ldubost>   <id>pdfviewer</id>  
12:53 <ldubost>   <formats>  
12:53 <ldubost>     <format>zip</format>  
12:53 <ldubost>   </formats>  
12:53 <ldubost>   <includeBaseDirectory>true</includeBaseDirectory>  
12:53 <ldubost>   <fileSets>  
12:53 <ldubost>     <fileSet>  
12:53 <ldubost>       <directory>${basedir}/src/main/ressources</directory>  
12:53 <ldubost>       <outputDirectory></outputDirectory>  
12:53 <ldubost>     </fileSet>  
12:53 <ldubost>   </fileSets>  
12:53 <ldubost> </assembly>  
12:53 <ldubost> <assembly>  
12:53 <ldubost>   <id>pdfviewer</id>  
12:53 <ldubost>   <formats>  
12:53 <ldubost>     <format>zip</format>  
12:53 <ldubost>   </formats>  
12:53 <ldubost>   <includeBaseDirectory>true</includeBaseDirectory>  
12:53 <ldubost>   <fileSets>  
12:53 <ldubost>     <fileSet>  
12:53 <ldubost>       <directory>${basedir}/src/main/ressources</directory>  
12:53 <ldubost>       <outputDirectory></outputDirectory>  
12:53 <ldubost>     </fileSet>  
12:53 <ldubost> </assembly>  
12:53 <ldubost> <assembly>  
12:53 <ldubost>   <id>pdfviewer</id>  
12:53 <ldubost>   <formats>  
12:54 <ldubost>     <format>zip</format>  
12:54 <ldubost>   </formats>  
12:54 <ldubost>   <fileSets>  
12:54 <ldubost>     <fileSet>  
12:54 <ldubost>       <directory> basedir  /src/main/ressources</directory>  
12:54 <ldubost>       <outputDirectory></outputDirectory>  
12:54 <ldubost>     </fileSet>  
12:54 <ldubost>   </fileSets>  
12:54 <ldubost> </assembly>  
12:54 <ldubost> interesting.. I don't see my last message and the IRC bit does not like it  
12:57 <vmassol> ldubost: please don't copy/paste here  
12:57 <Enygma`> wouldn`t it be simpler to just use zip packaging for the maven artefact?  
12:57 <vmassol> you need to use pastebin or other tools like this gist too  
12:57 <ldubost> ok  
12:57 <vmassol> there's no zip packaging  
12:58 <vmassol> lunch, bbl  
13:00 <Enygma`> yeah, wonder why I remember one existing... guess not then.  
13:11 <ldubost> If I remember correctly there is a maven command to clean xwiki xml files for commit but I cannot find the documentation  
13:17 <vmassol> mvn xar:format  
13:18 <vmassol> (ldubost)  
13:18 <ldubost> should this be somewhere on xwiki.org ?  
13:19 <ldubost> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/CodeStyle -> XWiki XML Files ?  
13:20 <vmassol> yes good idea, I'll add it  
13:20 <ldubost> already doing it  
13:21 <ldubost> done.. you can take it from there  
13:23 <sburjan> is xwiki.org down ?  
13:24 <cjd> how long have we been using infinispan cache? does anyone know?  
13:26 <mrvanes> has joined #xwiki  
13:31 <vmassol> ldubost: done, see http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Building#HGeneratingaXAR

13:32 <cjd> thanks

13:37 <evalica> vmassol: there is nothing I can do - that problem appeared several times. The macros exists. It cames back after a restart or something.  
13:39 <vmassol> evalica: where is it? can't find it  
13:40 <evalica> vmassol: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWikiOrgCode/Heartbeat  
13:40 <evalica> object editor  
13:40 <evalica> it's int he same page declared  
13:41 <vmassol> fixed  
13:41 <vmassol> you could have done it  
13:41 <vmassol> ....  
13:42 <evalica> the cache ? hmmm - k  
13:47 <vmassol> mflorea: what's your status re commits for 4.4M1?  
13:47 <vmassol> going to try this one locally: http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium-4.3/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/212/testReport/org.xwiki.test.selenium/DocExtraTest/testDocExtraLoadingFromURLAnchor/  
14:11 <mflorea> vmassol: I only need to commit a functional test for http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8591  
14:11 <mflorea> (almost done)  
14:17 <tdelafosse> has quit  
14:25 <Enygma`> vmassol: if I want to depend on a ScriptService from a java component, what do I use to get the service injected? @Inject @Named("nameOfService") private ScriptService service; ? If so, do I have to cast each time the service instance to the class implementing the script service (since I have no methods in the ScriptService interface)?  
14:26 <Enygma`> is @Inject @Named("nameOfService") private ImplementationOfTheScriptService service; an option in the current CM?  
14:31 <Enygma`> mflorea: any idea?  
14:32 <Enygma`> on my only option is to lookup the service (using the CM) at least once (and possibly cache it in a field)  
14:32 <Enygma`> ?  
14:33 <mflorea> Enygma`: I don't understand the question. Script services are components, with hints, so they can be injects like any other component  
14:34 <Enygma`> yes, but when it is declared, I can only declare the ScriptService interface (which is useless to me unless I cast it to the proper implementation)  
14:34 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
14:34 <mflorea> yes, and you can cast it afterwards  
14:35 <Enygma`> mflorea: basically I need a method like getService() { return (ServiceImplementation) scriptService; } to avoid writing the cast 100x times  
14:35 <mflorea> sure :)  
14:35 <Enygma`> yeah... not very nice to work with services... anyway... thanks for confirming  
14:35 <Enygma`> would have been nice to be able to declare the implementation for injection  
14:36 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
14:36 <vmassol> Enygma`:  
14:36 <vmassol> "if I want to depend on a ScriptService from a java component,"  
14:36 <vmassol> that's bad start :)  
14:37 <vmassol> no java component should ever depend on a script service  
14:37 <vmassol> script services are meant exclusively for … scripts  
14:37 <sdumitriu> They should wrap a real service  
14:38 <sdumitriu> So depend on the real service  
14:38 <Enygma`> well, in my case (workspace), if I depend on the deprecated plugin API and the plugin is installed with the EM, then the plugin will not be registered in the xwiki.cfg... so I have to use the trick done my the script service (which initializes the plugin) and use the service instead.  
14:38 <vmassol> you shouldn't  
14:38 <vmassol> agaion  
14:38 <vmassol> no component should use scriupt service  
14:38 <Enygma`> well, I`m already using the internal class... and I was trying to limit the usage of the internal class to a minimum... (while using the relatively public script service / plugin API)  
14:38 <vmassol> now  
14:39 <Enygma`> (since the internal class of wiki manager is not a component)  
14:39 <vmassol> what you can do is create some other component and call that componen from both the script service and the java component  
14:43 <Enygma`> well, I`m not going to refactor the wiki manager plugin right now, so the script service is the cleanest way to do it for me for now (since I was using the PluginAPI before).

15:19 <vmassol> you should ask him

15:20 <mflorea> in any case, http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/1766/testReport/org.xwiki.test.wysiwyg/StandardFeaturesTest/testEditInFullScreen/ is not a flicker  
15:21 <vmassol> ok so we need to fix before releasing 4.4M1?  
15:22 <mflorea> we should at least see if it is a test problem, or an actual regression  
15:25 <mflorea> vmassol: and I want to commit the fix for http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8605 in 4.3.1 and 4.4M1, it's a small fix but it's important  
15:27 <vmassol> mflorea: I have to go away for 30mn  
15:28 <mflorea> ok, committing the fix for XWIKI-8605 then I'll check the WYSIWYG tests
